intro: Quinquelobus glaber, commonly known as the smoothleaf quinquelobus, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Bolivia. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
